page.title: 05THE COMMUNITY CENTRE
page.content:
{The Community Centre}was built in 1951; a pre-fabricated building known as a{"Horsa Hut"}was gifted by the Scottish Council of Social Service and joined to the small hall already being used. This was the property of the local branch of the{I.O.G.T.}and known as the{Temperance Hall;}it was used for the stage, dressing rooms, kitchen and toilets, while the "Horsa Hut" was used as the main hall.
{Events}include, in addition to {concerts}and{dances,}such things as {Industrial Shows, Sales of Work, Cards {Nights}and a sale room for{travelling {merchants.
It has been recommended that the "Horsa Hut" should be renewed. This may mean that the community centre may be moved to the school.
